rsbNotes.title: Ps 35
rsbNotes.text: Ps. 35 The psalm is a lament by one whose life is threatened. The psalm uses the language of warfare (vv. 1–3) as well as legal language (vv. 11, 23, 24). Twice the psalm comes to a climax with the figure of the offering of a vow in praise (vv. 18, 28).

rsbNotes.title: Ps 35:1
rsbNotes.text:
35:1 Contend. The word is a legal term that means “bring a case against someone.” Such language runs through the psalm (vv. 11–16, 23, 24), as David commits his case to God.

fight. The psalmist calls upon the Lord to wage war on his behalf.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 35:2
rsbNotes.text: 35:2 rise. A request that occurs in many of the psalms in the setting of warfare (cf. 3:7; 7:6; 12:5).

rsbNotes.title: Ps 35:3
rsbNotes.text: 35:3 your salvation. In the particular context, this phrase indicates victory in battle.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 35:5
rsbNotes.text: 35:5 like chaff. Easily scattered and unable to stand. See Ps. 1:4.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 35:7
rsbNotes.text: 35:7 without cause. The Lord’s righteous servant has done no evil to his enemies.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 35:8
rsbNotes.text: 35:8 Let destruction come upon him. The enemies’ evil intentions turn back on themselves. Their evil becomes their own judgment, a frequent theme in the prophets. If they dig a pit for someone they will fall into it themselves. See Ps. 7:14–16; 34:21.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 35:10
rsbNotes.text: 35:10 Lord, who is like you. Compare Ex. 15:11, in another divine warrior psalm. Vv. 9, 10 anticipate the sure victory of God.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 35:11
rsbNotes.text: 35:11 Malicious witnesses. The law condemns circulating false reports (Ex. 23:1). “Malicious” indicates the cruelty of such witnesses who want to harm the defendant.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 35:12
rsbNotes.text: 35:12 evil for good. The height of injustice; cf. Gen. 44:4; 1 Sam. 25:21; Ps. 38:20; 109:5; Prov. 17:13.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 35:13–14
rsbNotes.text: 35:13, 14 The psalmist did no evil to those who now attack him; he actively and sacrificially pursued their well-being.
